results.title: Oil: its origin and use
results.brief_description: This video, presented in four distinct sections, is a general introduction to work in the oil industry. It shows the story of oil and gas from their origins to uses. The sections include- origin and search: shows how oil and gas originated millions of years ago and how modern scientists discover the unlikely whereabouts of underground reservoirs. Drilling: shows how an exploration well is drilled on land, and contrasts this with modern offshore developments. Refining: shows how crude oil is converted into a host of useful products through the refinery process. Distribution and use: shows how these products are distributed all over the world, and used in an endless variety of ways.

results.creator_credit: Humphrey Swingler, Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. Candle power: the manufacture of candles, their use in Roman times and in Christian churches. 2. Tower for Llandarcy: covering the transport of a 130 ton treating tower for a new refinery in Wales.

results.title: Oil review. No. 10
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Swingler, Anglo Iranian Oil Company and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Magazine film in three sections: “War on winter” - showing modern methods of land clearance in northern Sweden; “Work on wax” - showing how another oil product is finding a multitude of everyday uses; “London’s times” - how oil helps to keep the phenomenal accuracy of the famous Big Ben.

results.title: Oil review. No. 08
results.creator_credit: Joe Mendoza, Humphrey Swingler, Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. Desert tractors: contrasting these vehicles with the camel caravan in conveying refinery equipment across the desert. 2. results.title: Oil review. No. 05
results.creator_credit: Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. The Gulf run: illustrates the delivery of oil by the SS “Khuzistan” to small ports on the Persian Gulf, a four days journey. 2. Turbo prop tour: the visit to Paris of the British jet-propelled civil airliner, the “Vickers Viscount” including shots whilst in flight, refuelling and landing.

results.title: Oil review. No. 04
results.creator_credit: Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. Transfer by road: a story of the moving of a giant new fractionating column from the workshop in which it was made to Grangemouth Refinery, in England. 2. Something small: a story of oil helping Danish farmers to produce more eggs. 3. Made to order: new glass apparatus for the Research Station at Sunbuyry (England) is made on the premises.
